intro: Cayratia retivenia, commonly known as the silver vine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, waxy leaves that emit a sweet scent when crushed. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds and mammals. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its unique fragrance and ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some regions.
